danfulea.math.numerical

Class SpecFunc

  • java.lang.Object
    • danfulea.math.numerical.SpecFunc

  • public class SpecFunc
extends java.lang.Object
    Evaluation of special functions class. Based on literature, including Numerical Recipes in C (Cambridge Univ.).
    Author:
    Dan Fulea, 06 OCT. 2006

      The real asinh function.
      static double asinh(double rads)
      This is just for testing! The output should be = input.
      static void beschb(double x)
      Evaluates gama1 and gama2 by Chebyshev expansion for |x| less or equal 1/2.
      static double bessi(int n, double x)
      Returns the modified Bessel function In(x) for any real x and n greater (or equal) than 2.
      static double bessi0(double x)
      Returns the modified Bessel function I0(x) for any real x.
      static double bessi1(double x)
      Returns the modified Bessel function I1(x) for any real x.
      static void bessik(double x, double xnu)
      Returns the modified Bessel functions ri = Iv, rk = Kv and their derivatives rip = I'v , rkp = K'v , for positive x and for xnu = v greater (or equal) than 0.
      static double bessj(int n, double x)
      Returns the Bessel function Jn(x) for any real x and n greater (or equal) than 2.
      static double bessj0(double x)
      Returns the Bessel function J0(x) for any real x.
      static double bessj1(double x)
      Returns the Bessel function J1(x) for any real x.
      static void bessjy(double x, double xnu)
      Returns the Bessel functions rj = Jv, ry = Yv and their derivatives rjp = J'v , ryp = Y'v, for positive x and for xnu = v greater than 0.
      static double bessk(int n, double x)
      Returns the modified Bessel function Kn(x) for positive x and n greater (or equal) than 2.
      static double bessk0(double x)
      Returns the modified Bessel function K0(x) for positive real x.
      static double bessk1(double x)
      Returns the modified Bessel function K1(x) for positive real x.
      static double bessy(int n, double x)
      Returns the Bessel function Yn(x) for positive x and n greater (or equal) than 2.
      static double bessy0(double x)
      Returns the Bessel function Y0(x) for positive x.
      static double bessy1(double x)
      Returns the Bessel function Y1(x) for positive x.
      static double beta(double z, double w)
      Returns the value of the beta function B(z,w).
      static double betacf(double a, double b, double x)
      Used by betai: Evaluates continued fraction for incomplete beta function by modified Lentz’s method.
      static double betai(double a, double b, double x)
      Returns the incomplete beta function Ix(a, b) = integral from 0 to x of t^(a-1)(1 - t)^(b-1)dt (a, b positives).
      static double bico(int n, int k)
      Returns the binomial coefficient (n,k)=Cn^k as a double number.
      static void cisi(double x)
      Computes the cosine and sine integrals Ci(x) and Si(x).
      static double cosh(double rads) 
      static double dawson(double x)
      Returns Dawson’s integral for any real x.
      static double degreeToRadian(double degs) 
      static double ei(double x)
      Computes the exponential integral Ei(x) = integral form -inf to x of exp(t)/tdt, for x greater than 0.
      static double elle(double phi, double ak)
      Legendre elliptic integral of the 2nd kind E(PHI, k), evaluated using Carlson’s functions RD and RF .
      static double ellf(double phi, double ak)
      Legendre elliptic integral of the 1st kind F(phi, k), evaluated using Carlson’s function RF.
      static double ellpi(double phi, double en, double ak)
      Legendre elliptic integral of the 3rd kind PI(PHI, n, k), evaluated using Carlson’s functions RJ and RF .
      static double ERF1(double X)
      Another algorithm for error function based on EGSnrc
      static double erfc1(double x)
      Another algorithm for complementary error function based on EGSnrc
      static double erfcc(double x)
      Returns the complementary error function erfc(x) with fractional error everywhere less than 1.2 × 10-7.
      static double erff(double x)
      Returns the error function erf(x).
      static double erffc(double x)
      Returns the complementary error function erfc(x).
      static double expint(int n, double x)
      Evaluates the exponential integral En(x)= integral from 1 to +inf of exp(-xt)/t^n dt.
      static double factln(int n)
      Returns ln(n!).
      static double factrl(int n)
      Returns the value n! as a double number.
      static void frenel(double x)
      Computes the Fresnel integrals S(x) and C(x) for all real x.
      static double gammln(double xx)
      Returns the value ln[GAMMA(xx)] for xx greater than 0.
      static double gammp(double a, double x)
      Returns the incomplete gamma function P(a, x) = [1/gamma(a)] Integral (from 0 to x) of exp(-t)t^(a-1)dt; a greater than 0.
      static double gammq(double a, double x)
      Returns the incomplete gamma function Q(a, x) = 1 - P(a, x).
      static void gcf(double a, double x)
      Returns the incomplete gamma function Q(a, x) evaluated by its continued fraction representation as gammcf_out.
      static void gser(double a, double x)
      Returns the incomplete gamma function P(a, x) evaluated by its series representation as gamser_out.
      static double plgndr(int l, int m, double x)
      Computes the associated Legendre polynomial Plm (x).
      static double rc(double x, double y)
      Computes Carlson’s degenerate elliptic integral, RC(x, y).
      static double rd(double x, double y, double z)
      Computes Carlson’s elliptic integral of the second kind, RD(x, y, z).
      static double rf(double x, double y, double z)
      Computes Carlson’s elliptic integral of the first kind, RF (x, y, z).
      static double rj(double x, double y, double z, double p)
      Computes Carlson’s elliptic integral of the third kind, RJ (x, y, z, p).
      static double sinh(double rads) 
      static void sncndn(double uu, double emmc)
      Returns the Jacobian elliptic functions sn(u, kc), cn(u, kc), and dn(u, kc).
      static void sphbes(int n, double x)
      Returns spherical Bessel functions jn(x), yn(x), and their derivatives j'n (x), y'n (x) for integer n.
      static double tanh(double rads)

        Parameters:

        Returns:

      • bessjy

        public static void bessjy(double x,
                          double xnu)
        Returns the Bessel functions rj = Jv, ry = Yv and their derivatives rjp = J'v , ryp = Y'v, for positive x and for xnu = v greater than 0. The relative accuracy is within one or two significant digits of EPS, except near a zero of one of the functions, where EPS controls its absolute accuracy. FPMIN is a number close to the machine’s smallest floating-point number. All internal arithmetic is in double precision.
        Parameters:
        x - x
        xnu - xnu

      • beschb

        public static void beschb(double x)
        Evaluates gama1 and gama2 by Chebyshev expansion for |x| less or equal 1/2. Also returns 1/gama(1 + x) and 1/gama(1 - x).
        Parameters:
        x - x

      • degreeToRadian

        public static double degreeToRadian(double degs)
        Parameters:
        degs - degs
        Returns:
        the radians

        Returns:

      • asinh_ok

        public static double asinh_ok(double rads)
        The real asinh function.
        Parameters:
        rads - input double which is a sinh
        Returns:
        its inverse

      • bessik

        public static void bessik(double x,
                          double xnu)
        Returns the modified Bessel functions ri = Iv, rk = Kv and their derivatives rip = I'v , rkp = K'v , for positive x and for xnu = v greater (or equal) than 0. The relative accuracy is within one or two significant digits of EPS. FPMIN is a number close to the machine’s smallest floating-point number. All internal arithmetic is in double precision.
        Parameters:
        x - x
        xnu - xnu

      • airy

        public static void airy(double x)
        Returns Airy functions Ai(x), Bi(x), and their derivatives Ai'(x), Bi'(x).
        Parameters:
        x - x

      • sphbes

        public static void sphbes(int n,
                          double x)
        Returns spherical Bessel functions jn(x), yn(x), and their derivatives j'n (x), y'n (x) for integer n.
        Parameters:
        n - n
        x - x

      • plgndr

        public static double plgndr(int l,
                            int m,
                            double x)
        Computes the associated Legendre polynomial Plm (x). Here m and l are integers satisfying m is in [0,l] while x is in the range [-1,1]. Useful in quantum mechanics when describing atoms (wave equation is solved by separation of variables in spherical coordinates).
        Parameters:
        l - l
        m - m
        x - x
        Returns:
        the result

      • frenel

        public static void frenel(double x)
        Computes the Fresnel integrals S(x) and C(x) for all real x.
        Parameters:
        x - x

      • cisi

        public static void cisi(double x)
        Computes the cosine and sine integrals Ci(x) and Si(x). Ci(0) is returned as a large negative number and no error message is generated. For x less than 0 the routine returns Ci(-x) and you must supply the -iPI yourself.
        Parameters:
        x - x

      • dawson

        public static double dawson(double x)
        Returns Dawson’s integral for any real x.
        Parameters:
        x - x
        Returns:
        the result

      • rf

        public static double rf(double x,
                        double y,
                        double z)
        Computes Carlson’s elliptic integral of the first kind, RF (x, y, z). x, y, and z must be nonnegative, and at most one can be zero. TINY must be at least 5 times the machine underflow limit, BIG at most one fifth the machine overflow limit.
        Parameters:
        x - x
        y - y
        z - z
        Returns:
        the result

      • rd

        public static double rd(double x,
                        double y,
                        double z)
        Computes Carlson’s elliptic integral of the second kind, RD(x, y, z). x and y must be nonnegative, and at most one can be zero. z must be positive. TINY must be at least twice the negative 2/3 power of the machine overflow limit. BIG must be at most 0.1 × ERRTOL times the negative 2/3 power of the machine underflow limit.
        Parameters:
        x - x
        y - y
        z - z
        Returns:
        the result

      • rj

        public static double rj(double x,
                        double y,
                        double z,
                        double p)
        Computes Carlson’s elliptic integral of the third kind, RJ (x, y, z, p). x, y, and z must be nonnegative, and at most one can be zero. p must be nonzero. If p less than 0, the Cauchy principal value is returned. TINY must be at least twice the cube root of the machine underflow limit, BIG at most one fifth the cube root of the machine overflow limit.
        Parameters:
        x - x
        y - y
        z - z
        p - p
        Returns:
        the result

      • rc

        public static double rc(double x,
                        double y)
        Computes Carlson’s degenerate elliptic integral, RC(x, y). x must be nonnegative and y must be nonzero. If y less than 0, the Cauchy principal value is returned. TINY must be at least 5 times the machine underflow limit, BIG at most one fifth the machine maximum overflow limit.
        Parameters:
        x - x
        y - y
        Returns:
        the result

      • ellf

        public static double ellf(double phi,
                          double ak)
        Legendre elliptic integral of the 1st kind F(phi, k), evaluated using Carlson’s function RF. The argument ranges are: PHI in [0, PI/2], k x sin(PHI) in [0,1].
        Parameters:
        phi - phi
        ak - ak
        Returns:
        the result

      • elle

        public static double elle(double phi,
                          double ak)
        Legendre elliptic integral of the 2nd kind E(PHI, k), evaluated using Carlson’s functions RD and RF . The argument ranges are PHI in [0, PI/2], k x sin(PHI) in [0,1].
        Parameters:
        phi - phi
        ak - ak
        Returns:
        the result

      • ellpi

        public static double ellpi(double phi,
                           double en,
                           double ak)
        Legendre elliptic integral of the 3rd kind PI(PHI, n, k), evaluated using Carlson’s functions RJ and RF . (Note that the sign convention on n is opposite that of Abramowitz and Stegun.) The argument ranges are PHI in [0, PI/2], k x sin(PHI) in [0,1].
        Parameters:
        phi - phi
        en - en
        ak - ak
        Returns:
        the result

      • sncndn

        public static void sncndn(double uu,
                          double emmc)
        Returns the Jacobian elliptic functions sn(u, kc), cn(u, kc), and dn(u, kc). Here uu = u, while emmc = kc^2.
        Parameters:
        uu - uu
        emmc - emmc
